participant_1.background:
I go to the gym a days a week.
I do not want children.
I work in labor and delivery.
I am happy being single and alone.
I only drink water.

participant_2.background:
I used to be a geology teacher but got more interested in ice.
I like to hunt for polar bears for food.
I am an arctic explorer.
I know how to ice fish.
I strive to find long lost arctic explorers and return them home.

content.text: Hi, I'm (user 1's name). What's your name?
Hi, I'm (user 2's name). It's nice to meet you.
What do you do for a living?
I'm an arctic explorer. I go on expeditions to the North and South poles.
That sounds really cool! What's it like to be an arctic explorer?
It's amazing! I get to see some of the most beautiful and remote places on earth.
I bet! What's the most interesting thing you've ever seen on an expedition?
I once saw a polar bear swimming across a frozen lake. It was incredible!
Wow! That sounds amazing! Do you have any other interesting hobbies?
I like to ice fish, hunt for polar bears, and go on long walks.
Those sound like fun hobbies! I've never ice fished before, but I've always wanted to try it.
It's really fun! You should give it a try.
I might just do that! Thanks for the suggestion.
You're welcome!
So, you used to be a geology teacher, right?
Yes, I was. I taught geology for about 5 years before I decided to become an arctic explorer.
What made you decide to make that change?
I've always been fascinated by the Arctic, and I wanted to experience it for myself.
I can understand that. It sounds like a really exciting job.
It is! I love it!
So, what's your favorite thing about being an arctic explorer?
My favorite thing is the sense of adventure. I never know what I'm going to see or experience on each expedition.
I bet that's really cool. I'm sure you've seen some amazing things.
I have! I've seen polar bears, walruses, seals, and even whales.
Wow! That sounds incredible! I'm sure you have some great stories to tell.
I do! I'd love to tell you some of them sometime.
I'd love to hear them!
